People really don't understand the significance of this battle. It has nothing to do with either channel but more so of what they represent. T-Series is a giant corporation whereas PewDiePie is a solo content creator. It's not, "Let's root for PewDiePie cause we like him." It's more so, "Let's root for PewDiePie to keep YouTube the way it is." You shouldn't want the most subbed channel to be a company. It shows q complete failure of the YouTube brand. The whole purpose of YouTube was that anyone can get on here and make content that can be see by anyone. T-Series does not represent that and therefore should not be #1.
